availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moreau B. Pulliam (Mercer Co, Harrodsburg, Ky, carpenter & lieut, sgt, maj, commissary 11th Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Wood Pulliam in Mercer County, Kentucky, on March 17, 1836. Married to Louisa M. Alexander Pulliam in Mercer County on September 3, 1853. Father of Judson Pulliam, Robert Pulliam, John Pulliam, and Davis Pulliam. Carpenter in Mercer County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Carpenter in Mercer County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Mercer County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, sergeant major, first lieutenant, and commissary from September 22, 1862 to January 11, 1865. Captured in Monroe County, Tennessee, on October 20, 1863. Exchanged in 1865. Died of disease on January 11, 1865.
